src:
佐科威总统出席曼谷第35届东盟峰会全体会议 东盟-中国建立战略伙伴关系是区域和平稳定的支柱

04 Nov 2019, 03:51

【印尼CNBC新闻网11月3日讯】东盟峰会及东亚合作领导人系列会议11月2日在泰国曼谷Impact Exhibition and Convention Center国际会议中心举行。我国总统佐科威及东盟国家元首均出席第35届东盟峰会全体会议。陪同佐科威总统出席第35届东盟峰会的有政法安统筹部长马福特(Mahfud MD)、 经济统筹部长艾尔朗卡．哈尔丹托(Airlangga Hartarto)、外交部长蕾特诺马尔苏迪（Retno L P Marsudi）、贸易部长阿古斯.苏巴尔曼多(Agus Suparmanto)和内阁秘书帕拉摩诺阿侬（Pramono Anung）。佐科威总统感谢和赞赏泰国政府2019年担任东盟轮值主席期间对东盟的贡献。总统也感谢东盟国家元首和代表于10月20日出席在雅京国会大厦举行佐科威-马鲁夫阿敏正副总统2019-2024届宣誓就职典礼。雷诺外长周日（11月3日）在峰会会议后向传媒发表讲话说，东盟国家领导人峰会的讨论议题其中是关于区域全面经济伙伴关系协议（RCEP）的谈判进程。东盟国家领导人一致同意并希望加快与RCEP有关的谈判进展能尽快完成，亦推动实现地区共同繁荣和发展。东盟10国与中国、日本、韩国、澳大利亚、新西兰、印度6个对话伙伴国领导人还将举行区域《全面经济伙伴关系协定》领导人会议，力争推动这一多边贸易协议达成。RCEP由东盟10国于2012年发起，邀请中国、日本、韩国、澳洲、新西兰、印度共同参加，旨在通过削减关税及非关税壁垒，建立区域统一市场。雷诺外长接着说，佐科威总统还传达了许多其他问题，例如缅甸若开邦（Rakhine State）的人道危机问题并呼吁东盟国家领导人携手协助解决相关问题。雷诺外长如是阐述。此外，佐科威总统冀望东盟国家加强合作共同应对《东盟关于印度太平洋展望》的议题。出席第35届东盟峰会全体会议国家和政府领导人有泰国总理巴育、新加坡总理李显龙、菲律宾总统杜特尔特、老挝总理通伦、缅甸国务资政昂山素季、柬埔寨总理洪森、马来西亚总理马哈蒂尔、越南政府总理阮春和汶莱苏丹哈吉哈桑纳尔。（v）
text:
President Zokwe attends the 35th ASEAN Summit Plenary Session of the ASEAN-China Strategic Partnership is the pillar of regional peace and stability

04 Nov 2019, 03:51

[Indonesia CNBC News Network November 3rd] The ASEAN Summit and East Asia Cooperation Leaders Series was held on November 2nd at the Impact Exhibition and Convention Center in Bangkok, Thailand. Chinese President Jokowi and the ASEAN Heads of State attended the 35th ASEAN Summit Plenary Meeting. Accompanied by President Jokawi’s attendance at the 35th ASEAN Summit, Mahfud MD, Minister of Economic Planning and Coordinator, and Erlanga, Minister of Economic Coordination. Airlangga Hartarto, Foreign Minister Retno L P Marsudi, Trade Minister Agus Suparmanto and Cabinet Secretary Pramono Anung. President Zocco thanked and appreciated the contribution of the Thai government to ASEAN during its 2019 ASEAN presidency. The President also thanked the ASEAN heads of state and representatives for attending the inauguration ceremony of the 2019-2024 Vice President Jokowi-Maluf Amin at the Yajing Parliament Building on October 20. Foreign Minister Renault said to the media after the summit meeting on Sunday (November 3) that the discussion topic of the ASEAN Leaders Summit is about the negotiation process of the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (RCEP). The leaders of the ASEAN countries unanimously agreed and hoped that the progress of the negotiations related to the RCEP could be completed as soon as possible, and also promote the common prosperity and development of the region. The leaders of the 10 ASEAN countries and China, Japan, South Korea, Australia, New Zealand and India will also hold regional leaders of the Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement to promote this multilateral trade agreement. Launched in 2012 by the 10 ASEAN countries, RCEP invited China, Japan, South Korea, Australia, New Zealand and India to participate in the establishment of a regional unified market by reducing tariffs and non-tariff barriers. Foreign Minister Renault went on to say that President Zocco also conveyed many other issues, such as the humanitarian crisis in Rakhine State, Myanmar, and called on the leaders of ASEAN countries to work together to help solve the related problems. Foreign Minister Renault stated. In addition, President Zocco hopes that ASEAN countries will strengthen cooperation and jointly address the issue of ASEAN's Outlook on the Indian Ocean. At the 35th ASEAN Summit Plenary Session, the leaders of the state and government include Thai Prime Minister Yard Yu, Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, Philippine President Duterte, Lao Prime Minister Tong Lun, Myanmar State Affairs Aung San Suu Kyi, Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Sen, Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir, Vietnamese Prime Minister Hunchun and Brunei Sultan Haji Hassanal. (v)
